title: I know asking for Ahri buffs is goddamn near blasphemous on the boards but...
body: Could Ahri's Foxfire please prioritize charmed targets? Feels like shit when I pop W to combo the enemy ADC but all of that damage is nullified because a tank simply exists near me. Honestly, the ability itself already kinda sucks. Can we get the one change?

You are right, foxfire prioritizes Ahri's most recent AA target. However it's a little bit complicated at the same time.

Foxfire prioritizes nearby champions, but does not have a buffer period when it comes to targeting. Basically meaning the Foxfire chooses a target if one is available. 

If you W when you are NOT in range of an enemy champion, it will choose your most recently AA'd target. But if you move into W range of a champion this will change the targeting AI (If you can call it that) to target champions, but since you were in the vicinity of previously AA'd minions in the meantime, the Fire's have already targetted the minions and fired off. 

It's mostly a case of the Foxfire targetting AI being wacky af and lacking consistency.

I strongly suspect this is another case of "it doesn't feel right gameplay-wise so it must be bad balance-wise" mistake that is all too common on the boards.

Her winrate is that high because ahri is the champion least likely to feed making the game harder for her own teammates so they can carry her.

I'm quite aware of her playstyle and game impact. She follows Janna's influence where it's really easy to not be a drag on your team so you're statistically guaranteed to have an even winrate. What I don't understand how people aren't getting the last line of my sentence.

Ahri is a balanced, and even statistically a strong pick right now. I'll take a quote from my latest response to Ahri Body Pillow:

"You're buffing a weak ability on a champion that doesn't need buffs overall, which makes 0 sense from a balance perspective. I'm all for making a champion feel better and play smoother, but a straight buff to a balanced champion is undeniably not the way to do it."

She doesn't lose her safety, but she gains impact. That doesn't make sense from a balance perspective, and that's why a straight buff makes 0 sense. If you want to make her play smoother through buffs, she needs to give something up in return. Buff a balanced champion = needs a compensation nerf
